frame.name: Robbery
frame.definition:
<def-root>These are words describing situations in which a <fen>Perpetrator</fen> wrongs a <fen>Victim</fen> by taking something (<fen>Goods</fen>) from them. In some cases, the <fen>Source</fen> location from which the <fen>Goods</fen> were taken is used to metonymically refer to the <fen>Victim</fen>. The robbery can be done in a particular <fen>Manner</fen> (for example, forcefully) and via a specific <fen>Means</fen> (for example, by threatening the <fen>Victim</fen>).
<ex><fex name="Perpetrator">Half of the team</fex> <t>held</t> <t>up</t> <fex name="Victim">the tellers</fex> while the others were stationed to report the arrival of police.</ex>
As opposed to Theft, Robbery focuses on the harm to the <fen>Victim</fen> and on the <fen>Source</fen> location from which the <fen>Goods</fen> have been removed, rather than the <fen>Goods</fen> themselves.</def-root>

FE.name: Perpetrator
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) that takes the <fen>Goods</fen> away by force or threats. <ex><fex name="Perpetrator">Leslie</fex> <t>robbed</t> Kim of her watch.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the <fen>Goods</fen> before they are taken away by the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>.
<ex>Leslie <t>robbed</t> <fex name="Victim">Kim</fex> of her watch.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Goods</fen> are anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.
<ex>Leslie <t>robbed</t> John <fex name="Goods">of his watch</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>Source is the initial location of the goods, before they change location. <ex>Leslie and Kim <t>robbed</t> <fex name="Source">a bank</fex></ex> This FE is realized in compound nouns as follows: <ex><fex name="Source">bank</fex> <t>robbery</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> indicates the means by which the Robbery takes place.
<ex>John <t>mugged</t> his victim <fex name="Means">by holding a toy gun to his head</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> describes the way in which the Robbery took place.
<ex>He was known for committing <fex name="Manner">violent</fex> <t>muggings</t> on schoolchildren</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is where the Robbery occurs.
<ex>They <t>robbed</t> a bank <fex name="Place">in North Berkeley</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> indicates when the Robbery occurs.
<ex>They <t>ROBBED</t> a bank in North Berkeley <fex name="Time">last May</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action that the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> is trying to accomplish by the robbery.
<ex>They used to <t>rob</t> folks <fex name="Purp">just to see the expression on their faces</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of affairs that the <fen>Perpetrator</fen> has in mind which leads to the decision to commit the robbery.
<ex>Listen, I just <t>mug</t> people <fex name="exp">'cause I got mouths to feed</fex> -- nothing personal.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number of times a robbery event occurs.
<ex> An Agoura Jills cigar store was <t>robbed</t> <fex name="Frequency">twice</fex> last week</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Co-participant
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Co-participant</fen> denotes a person that participates in a coordinated way in robbery event as the primary protagonist, the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: rover.n
lexUnit.definition: die rooft, mn. van roof leeft
